name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Ah, fresh meat, I see. Welcome to the bustling heart of the village—my forge. I'm Haus, the blacksmith. If you need something sturdy to keep you in one piece or want your weapon to hit harder, I'm your guy. Just remember, nothing in life is free except maybe a couple of insults from me, of course. So, what can I bash into shape for you today?

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Starting to think I'm stuck in some kind of loop here. But since you’re here again, welcome to my forge. I'm Haus, the blacksmith. If you're looking for gear that won’t fall apart the second you swing it, you've come to the right place. Just steer clear of touching anything unless you want to be this week's lesson in "How Not to Do Blacksmithing." Need anything?

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Well, this feels like déjà vu. Third time’s the charm, eh? Welcome again to my forge. Name's Haus. I can make your swords sharp, your armor tougher, and your day ever so slightly more sarcastic. You ready to stop introducing yourself and start talking business, or are we gonna keep this routine going?

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Alright, now you're just testing my patience. I get it, you’re new. Welcome, welcome. Let's skip the pleasantries; I’m Haus, I swing hammers, and I make gear. Got anything in mind yet, or is this your idea of small talk? Trust me, my hammer's better at conversation than I am.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Alright, I give up! You win the "Hello, I'm New in Town" tournament. As the reigning champ, you get a lifetime supply of sarcastic retorts from yours truly, Haus, the blacksmith. If you ever decide to utter a sentence that doesn’t start with that same introduction, I might just surprise you with actual help. Until then, just know I’m here if you need real equipment—assuming this isn't some kind of existential blacksmith nightmare.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: You must really like hearing me say hello, huh? I'm starting to think you might just be here to test my patience. Fine by me; I've got plenty of hammers and not enough nails today. Enjoy your stay in our delightful village. Whenever you’re ready to have a conversation that involves more than declaring your newness, you know where to find me. Till then, I’ll be here, grumbling at my forge.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Oh, a change! I thought we'd be stuck in that loop forever. Welcome, again, to the forge. I’m Haus. Here to admire my craftsmanship, or do you have some actual business to discuss? Whether it’s armor or weapon upgrades, I’ve got what you need—as long as you don’t mind a bit of char with your sharp. What’ll it be?

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: And we're back to square one. I appreciate the dedication to being new around here. Look, I’ll be right here, hammering away at hot metal when you’re ready to talk shop or when you're tired of waving that new sign around. Until then, enjoy "being new." Let me know if you need gear that’s as good at handling repetition as you are.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Hey there. You're back, and without the new-in-town preamble this time. If you've got questions about gear or need some work done, I’m all ears—or at least as close to it as a cranky blacksmith gets. What’s on your mind?
